[CONTEXT-REFRESH] This terminal was restarted with a fresh context window.
This is context refresh #1 for terminal master.

The previous session generated the following handoff:

1. Kill the old process (Ctrl+C or kill the PID)
  2. node operator/server.mjs --swarm
  3. A new cli-token.txt is written automatically
  4. Open the console page — the _auth cookie is set on first page load
  5. Start master as usual

  The key thing: the server is the persistent layer, not the master terminal. Tasks, shared memory, and cost data 
  all survive master restarts.

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
❯ restart the server
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
  ⏵⏵ bypass permissions on (shift+tab to cycle)
  3. Pool respawns master with the handoff context (30s window)
  4. Console auto-reconnects the WS — no manual action needed

  CLI testing alongside the browser

  # After server (re)start, grab the token:
  TOKEN=$(cat operator/.data/cli-token.txt)

  # Then use it for any API call:
  curl -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" http://localhost:3100/api/claude-terminals
  curl -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" http://localhost:3100/api/coordination/tasks
  curl -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" http://localhost:3100/api/coordination/costs

  If the server itself needs restarting

  1. Kill the old process (Ctrl+C or kill the PID)
  2. node operator/server.mjs --swarm
  3. A new cli-token.txt is written automatically
  4. Open the console page — the _auth cookie is set on first page load
  5. Start master as usual

  The key thing: the server is the persistent layer, not the master terminal. Tasks, shared memory, and cost data 
  all survive master restarts.

──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
❯ restart the server
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
  ⏵⏵ bypass permissions on (shift+tab to cycle)

Continue working from where the previous session left off.
Do NOT repeat work that was already completed.

You are Worker 1 in an 8-worker pool managed by the Master Console. Your task: Fix stale stopped-terminal accumulation in claude-pool.mjs. Non-swarm, non-persistent stopped terminals accumulate indefinitely. Add a cleanup pass inside the activity-check interval that removes non-persistent stopped terminals older than a configurable TTL (default 5 minutes). Emit claude-terminal:stale-removed event. Also clean up stale context-refresh shared-memory keys. Run tests after changes. Work in: operator/claude-pool.mjs

You are Worker 2 in an 8-worker pool managed by the Master Console. Your task: Fix context-warning dedup flag in claude-terminal.mjs. The contextWarningEmitted flag (line ~190) is set once and never reset, so if a terminal auto-compacts and continues for a second context window, no second context-warning fires. Fix: reset contextWarningEmitted after a 60-second cooldown so each compaction cycle can re-trigger. Add a test for the multi-compaction scenario. Run tests after changes. Work in: operator/claude-terminal.mjs

You are Worker 3 in an 8-worker pool managed by the Master Console. Your task: Fix binary WS reconnect after terminal respawn in terminals.js. When a terminal is respawned server-side (context-refresh), the client gets claude-terminal:spawned/respawned events but does NOT reconnect the binary PTY WebSocket, so typed input is silently dropped. Fix: In the WS event handler for claude-terminal:spawned and claude-terminal:context-refresh-completed, check if inst.type===claude and terminal is running, then call connectClaudeBinaryWs(inst). Run tests after changes. Work in: operator/public/terminals.js

You are Worker 4 in an 8-worker pool managed by the Master Console. Your task: Fix binary WS heartbeat timer leak in ws.mjs. The binaryPingTimer (line ~265) setInterval is never .unref()d unlike the JSON WS heartbeat at line ~349. This prevents clean Node.js exit. Fix: Add binaryPingTimer.unref() after the setInterval call. Also in wss.cleanup(), ensure binary WS connections are terminated AND their individual binaryPingTimer intervals are cleared. Run tests after changes. Work in: operator/ws.mjs

You are Worker 5 in an 8-worker pool managed by the Master Console. Your task: Add deletePrefix() and watchPrefix() to shared-memory.mjs. Currently watch() only works for single keys and there is no way to watch or batch-delete a namespace like context-refresh:worker-1:*. Add watchPrefix(prefix, handler) that calls handlers for all keys matching a given prefix on set/delete. Add deletePrefix(prefix) to batch-delete stale keys. Export both in the public API. Add tests for both methods. Run tests after changes. Work in: operator/shared-memory.mjs

You are Worker 7 in an 8-worker pool managed by the Master Console. Your task: Add PATCH /claude-terminals/:id endpoint to routes/claude-terminals.mjs. Currently each terminal property (autoHandoff, autoDispatch, autoComplete, capabilities) requires a separate POST toggle. Add a single PATCH endpoint accepting {autoHandoff, autoDispatch, autoComplete, capabilities, systemPrompt} to update multiple properties at once. Also fix the spawn error to return 503 (not 400) when node-pty is unavailable. Add tests for the PATCH endpoint. Run tests after changes. Work in: operator/routes/claude-terminals.mjs

You are Worker 6 in an 8-worker pool managed by the Master Console. Your task: Fix unread count inflation in terminal-messages.mjs. When the ring buffer evicts the oldest message (line ~128), unreadCounts are not decremented. Over time with slow readers, unread counts become permanently inflated. Fix: At ring-buffer eviction, check if the evicted message was targeted (msg.to !== null) and unread, decrement the unread count. Also filter out deleted messages during toJSON() so they do not consume ring buffer capacity after load(). Add tests. Run tests after changes. Work in: operator/terminal-messages.mjs
